intro: Cynoglottis chetikiana subsp. paphlagonica, commonly known as the Paphlagonian cynoglottis, is a rare and endemic plant species native to specific regions of Turkey. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes many aromatic and medicinal plants. The plant typically grows in rocky or limestone soils, often in mountainous areas with a temperate climate. Its leaves are compound, with a distinctive fern-like appearance, and it produces small, greenish-yellow flowers in umbel-like clusters. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a species of conservation concern.
